questions.title: Design a Check/Cheque Deposit System (Mobile + ATM)
questions.prompt: Design an end-to-end system for depositing a physical check via a mobile app (photo capture) or ATM. Consider image processing, validation, fraud checks, and core banking ledger updates.
followups: How do you ensure exactly-once processing of the deposit?
What is your strategy for handling duplicate image submissions?
How do you maintain consistency between the 'available balance' and 'actual ledger' during check clearing (float)?
The interviewer pushed back: 'Your design relies on a single database. What happens if that database region goes down during a deposit?' How do you handle multi-region failover?

questions.title: ConcurrentHashMap Internals & Custom Caching Layer
questions.prompt: Explain the internal architecture of `ConcurrentHashMap` in Java 8+. Specifically, how does it handle concurrent writes without locking the entire map? Now, design a time-based expiration cache using `ConcurrentHashMap` that is thread-safe and high-throughput.
followups: What is the purpose of the `table` array and what are `Node`, `TreeNode`, and `ForwardingNode`?
How does `ConcurrentHashMap` count size using `LongAdder`-like counters?
In your custom cache, how do you proactively evict expired entries without blocking `get()` requests?
What are the memory visibility guarantees between threads using your cache?

questions.title: JVM Performance Tuning: High CPU / Memory Leak
questions.prompt: Your trading application is running on a JVM. Suddenly, it starts consuming 100% CPU or you observe a gradual memory increase leading to an OutOfMemoryError. Walk me through your exact diagnosis and remediation strategy.
followups: What commands do you run immediately (e.g., `top`, `jstat`, `jstack`)?
How do you capture a heap dump and analyze it with Eclipse MAT or JProfiler?
You find a classloader leak. How did that happen and how do you fix it without restarting the JVM?
How do you set up proactive alerts to catch this before it crashes?

questions.title: Design a Real-Time Fraud Detection Engine
questions.prompt: Design a low-latency (sub-100ms) fraud detection engine for credit card swipes. It must handle 10k+ TPS, apply rule-based checks (velocity, country blocks), and a machine learning model score. If flagged, the transaction is declined.
followups: How do you shard the data by customer ID to maintain session state (e.g., 5 transactions in 5 minutes)?
How do you update the ML model in production without stopping the stream?
What consistency trade-off do you make when reading the customer's blocklist?
How do you audit why a specific transaction was declined for compliance?

questions.title: Distributed Transaction Coordinator (Banking Ledger)
questions.prompt: We need to transfer $100 from Account A (in DB1) to Account B (in DB2). DB1 and DB2 are on separate database clusters. Design a system to ensure atomicity (either both accounts update or neither does). You cannot use a single 2PC coordinator due to the 'blocking' problem.
followups: How does the Saga pattern (Choreography vs Orchestration) solve this?
What do you store in the 'compensation' transaction log?
If the orchestration service crashes after debiting Account A but before crediting Account B, how do you recover?
How do you handle idempotency if the bank retries the request?

questions.title: Garbage Collection Deep Dive
questions.prompt: Explain the difference between G1GC, ZGC, and Shenandoah. If JPMC told you to migrate a low-latency trading application from G1 to ZGC, what metrics would you monitor to validate the switch?
followups: What are the trade-offs of using concurrent GC (e.g., ZGC) regarding CPU overhead vs pause times?
How do you force a Full GC and why is it dangerous in production?
What is the difference between a minor, major, and full GC event?

questions.title: Design a High-Availability Payment Gateway
questions.prompt: Design a payment gateway that routes transactions to multiple acquiring banks. It must have 99.99% availability. Discuss how you handle bank timeouts, partial failures, and idempotency.
followups: How do you implement a circuit breaker pattern for a bank that is responding slowly?
What is your strategy for idempotency keys to prevent double charging?
How do you test chaos engineering (e.g., killing a random server) in this system?
How do you reconcile transactions at the end of the day when banks send you files?

questions.title: Code Review: Immutability and Thread Safety
questions.prompt: (PR Review) A developer has written a Java class to represent a `Trade` object. All fields are `private final`. The class contains a `Date` field and a `List<String>` field with getters that return the raw references. What are the thread-safety and security issues?
followups: Why is `java.util.Date` mutable? How do you fix this?
How do you create a truly immutable collection?
If the list is large, what is the performance impact of your defensive copying strategy?
What is the difference between shallow immutability and deep immutability?

questions.title: Database Design: Ride-Sharing Schema
questions.prompt: Design the database schema for a ride-sharing app (like Uber). Include tables for users, drivers, rides, locations, and payments. How do you query for nearby drivers?
followups: How do you handle geo-spatial queries efficiently (e.g., find drivers within 5 miles)?
What is the difference between using PostGIS, Elasticsearch, or a simple grid system?
How do you partition the `rides` table by date?
How do you maintain consistency between the ride status and the payment transaction?

questions.title: Spring Boot: Internal Working of Autowiring
questions.prompt: Explain, at a deep level, how Spring Boot's `@Autowired` works under the hood. What role does the `BeanFactory`, `ApplicationContext`, and `PostProcessor` play?
followups: How does Spring resolve circular dependencies (e.g., Bean A depends on B, B depends on A)?
What is the difference between Singleton and Prototype scope in terms of lifecycle?
How would you implement your own `@InjectRandomInt` annotation using a `BeanPostProcessor`?

questions.title: Behavioral: Handling Executive Pushback
questions.prompt: Tell me about a time you proposed a technical solution and received significant pushback from higher management or a senior architect. How did you handle it?
followups: How did you prepare data or evidence to support your case?
Did you compromise? If so, how did you ensure quality wasn't completely sacrificed?
What was the outcome and what did you learn about influencing without authority?

questions.title: Behavioral: Code for Good / Social Impact
questions.prompt: JPMC heavily emphasizes the 'Code for Good' hackathon. Tell me about a time you used your technical skills to solve a problem for a community or non-profit organization.
followups: What was the specific problem and who were the users?
What constraints (time, resources, technical debt) did you face?
How did you ensure the solution was sustainable after you left?
